summary: This is an email from January 11, 2020, discussing a recent conversation between Jeffrey Epstein's legal team and the Chief of the Criminal Division of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The email notes the conversation was lengthy and productive, and that the Chief will follow up with dates for a presentation.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient of the email discussing a conversation with Epstein's legal team.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Chief, Criminal Division, U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY
persons.context: The email states she had a lengthy and productive conversation with Epstein's legal team and will get back to them with dates for a presentation.

connections.description: Strauss, as Chief of the Criminal Division, had a conversation with Epstein's legal defense team regarding their case.

events.title: Conversation between SDNY and Epstein legal team
events.description: Audrey Strauss, Chief of the Criminal Division for SDNY, had a lengthy and seemingly productive conversation with Jeffrey Epstein's legal counsel.

keyFacts: The email is dated January 11, 2020, after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to his case.
Audrey Strauss, then Chief of the Criminal Division for SDNY, communicated directly with Epstein's defense team.
The communication was described as 'lengthy and seemingly productive,' and involved scheduling a future presentation.
